name: thera-eruption

name: bronze-age-collapse
description: Multiple civilizations in the Mediterranean suddenly collapsed within decades.

name: plague-of-athens
description: A devastating epidemic killed up to a quarter of the Athenian population.

name: antonine-plague
description: A pandemic killed millions across the Roman Empire over fifteen years.

name: plague-of-cyprian
description: A deadly pandemic swept through the Roman Empire for nearly twenty years.

name: plague-of-justinian
description: Bubonic plague killed tens of millions across the Byzantine Empire.

name: volcanic-winter-536
description: A mysterious fog plunged Europe into darkness and cold for eighteen months.

name: damghan-earthquake
description: A massive earthquake in Iran killed an estimated 200,000 people.

name: aleppo-earthquake
description: A devastating earthquake struck Syria, killing over 200,000 people.

description: The bubonic plague arrived in Europe, eventually killing one-third of the population.

name: black-death-peak
description: The plague reached its deadliest year, devastating cities across Europe.

name: shaanxi-earthquake
description: The deadliest earthquake in history killed approximately 830,000 people in China.

name: great-plague-london
description: Bubonic plague killed nearly 100,000 Londoners in eighteen months.

description: A massive fire destroyed most of the medieval City of London.

description: A devastating famine killed approximately 10 million people in India.

description: Yellow fever killed about 5,000 people in the American capital.

name: indian-rebellion-famine
description: A severe famine in India killed over one million people.

description: A massive earthquake and subsequent fires devastated the California city.

description: The deadliest pandemic in modern history began infecting millions worldwide.

description: The deadly second wave of Spanish flu killed millions in autumn 1918.

description: A massive earthquake devastated Tokyo and Yokohama, killing over 100,000.

description: The stock market crashed, triggering the Great Depression.

description: Massive flooding killed up to four million people in central China.

description: A second atomic bomb was dropped on Japan three days after Hiroshima.

description: Mao's Great Leap Forward policies caused a famine killing tens of millions.

description: A drug prescribed to pregnant women caused thousands of birth defects worldwide.
